### Hadoop Distributed File System:

**Definition:** Distributed storage for big data.

### Key Features:
| Feature | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| Block storage | 128MB blocks |
| Replication | 3x by default |
| Fault tolerance | Handles failures |

### MapReduce:

**Phases:**
| Phase | Function |
|-------|----------|
| **Map** | Process input, emit key-value |
| **Shuffle** | Group by key |
| **Reduce** | Aggregate values |

### YARN:

**Yet Another Resource Negotiator**

### Components:
| Component | Role |
|-----------|------|
| ResourceManager | Cluster management |
| NodeManager | Node management |
| ApplicationMaster | Job coordination |

### Hadoop Ecosystem:

| Component | Purpose |
|-----------|--------|
| HDFS | Storage |
| MapReduce | Processing |
| YARN | Resource management |
| Common | Utilities |

### Ecosystem Tools:

| Tool | Purpose |
|------|--------|
| **Hive** | SQL on Hadoop |
| **Pig** | Data flow scripts |
| **HBase** | NoSQL database |
| **Sqoop** | Data import/export |
| **Flume** | Log collection |

title: When to Use Hadoop ü§î

answer.content:
### Use Hadoop When:

| Scenario | Because |
|----------|--------|
| Very large data | Scale horizontally |
| Batch processing | Not real-time |
| Cost-sensitive | Commodity hardware |
| Unstructured data | Handles any format |

explanation: **Hadoop** excels at batch processing large data.
